author: Special Correspondent
text:
Former All India Anna Dravida Munnetra Kazhagam (AIADMK) Minister C. Aranganayagam appeared in a special court trying Directorate of Vigilance and Anti-Corruption (DVAC) cases here on Wednesday.

According to police sources, the DVAC registered a disproportionate assets case against the former Minister in 1996. He was accused of possessing wealth to the tune of Rs. 92.22 lakh, which was disproportionate to his known sources of income.

The charge sheet was laid after ten years.

On the direction of K. Venkatasamy, X Additional Sessions Court Judge (in-charge), he appeared in the court where a day-to-day trial is on.

Mr. Aranganayagam was Education Minister in 1991-1996 regime of the AIADMK.
title: Former Minister appears in court
